Hello Harry,

On 8/14/06, huaishih_wen <hwen@...> wrote:
>  1. Can JUnit run test methods in a particular order?

No. JUnit makes no promises whatsoever regarding the order in which
test methods are executed. This is by design--JUnit supports the
principle of test independence.


On 8/14/06, huaishih_wen <hwen@...> wrote:
>  2. What is the best approach to unit test database code?
>  3. What is the best approach to unit test threaded program?

There's no right answer to these questions. It would help, though, if
we could look at a concrete example.

Having said that, the short answer to 2) is that you might want to
look into mock objects and consider running tests for database code
against a lightweight, embedded database such as HSQLDB. The short
answer to 3) is, "separate the threading logic from what code the
threads are executing, test the sequential code as usual, and learn
the Java Thread API inside out to figure out how to test the threading
logic enough to gain a degree of confidence."

I happen to be in the process of writing longer "answers" to these
questions into what will become a book on test-driven development but
I'm afraid it'll still take a few months before it's going to be
available.

-Lasse-
